programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: In the last 10 years, the number of women arrested for driving drunk has risen by 30 percent, and police report that more and more young children are sitting in the back seat when these moms are pulled over.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: No matter how much we try to avoid it, conflict is a part of life. But what happens when an entire family points the finger at one person as the source of the chaos?

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.sub-title: Take Your Hands Off My Man!
programme.desc: Theresa says her fiancé, Bill’s, ex-girlfriend, Melissa, is jealous and obsessed with trying to ruin their relationship. She claims Melissa is a “psycho stalker” who is making their lives “hell” by sending Bill naked pictures of herself and showing up at his workplace unannounced. Melissa, who has a 3-year-old son with Bill, blames Theresa for destroying their family. She says Bill cheated on her with Theresa when she was pregnant with their son - so for revenge, she claims she has slept with Bill several times since he has been with Theresa. Bill admits he has made mistakes, including cheating on Theresa twice with Melissa but claims she took advantage of him. He says he’s tired of being stuck in the middle of their drama and just wants to peacefully co-parent with Melissa and marry his true love, Theresa but is he sending mixed messages? And, Theresa says she doubts Bill is the father of Melissa’s 3-year-old son. What will the paternity results reveal? And, will everyone heed Dr. Phil’s advice to bring resolution to this drama-filled love triangle?

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Melanie says her 19-year-old daughter's boyfriend, Michael, is a gay, drug abusing gangbanger. What would cause her to have such a negative opinion of him? And is there any truth to her allegations? Learn why Michael initially agrees to a drug test, and then refuses. Will he finally break down and take it? And why does Melanie’s daughter, Caylin, support him anyway, regardless of the outcome? Then, Lori says her 17-year-old daughter, Mackenzie, is obsessed with a boy who's already broken up with her four times. Find out why Dr. Phil has a stern message for this mom.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Follow a dad, John Clark's journey as he searches for his missing family.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: An update with a father whose children were abducted by their mother.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Angelique recounts escaping a life-threatening scheme while pregnant.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.sub-title: Will Her Baby Be Born Addicted?
programme.desc: In a gripping 2-part series, a mother seeks help for her pregnant, drug-using teen.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: In a gripping 2-part series, Dr. Phil continues a drug intervention with an 18-year-old pregnant teen and her 20-year-sister.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: The saga of a father's quest for his vanished daughter is discussed.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: A mother admits to putting hot sauce in her 7-year-old adopted son's mouth.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Parents: How well do you know your teen? Could your daughter be indulging in harmful activities right beneath your nose? Anna says she was outraged when she discovered her daughter, Allie’s, secret addiction to prescription pills. Allie maintains that she’s been clean for four months, but Anna doesn’t believe her. She says the 19-year-old has been involved in three car accidents in the past seven months, and the police recently brought her home for erratic driving. Does Allie still have a problem with prescription meds? Will she agree to take a drug test? Then, 17 year-old Elizabeth wrote in to the Teen Talk forum because she says she’s leading a double life. She says her secret is eating her up inside, and she wants to confess to her parents. Find out what the young woman’s been hiding, and see how her folks respond when she drops the bombshell.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: A woman shares her harrowing ordeal of abuse from her husband.

programme.title: Dr.Phil
programme.sub-title: Engaged to My Teen with Braces
programme.desc: A mother is concerned her 17-year-old daughter is dating a 28-year-old divorced father.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Secrets are revealed in a family with a shopaholic wife and rageaholic husband.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.sub-title: No More Mooching: I’ve Been Laid Off!
programme.desc: As the economy struggles, many Americans are suffering financially and find themselves without extra cash in hand. Dr. Phil's guests say their money is maxed out, and they're tired of supporting their adult children too.

programme.title: Dr.Phil
programme.desc: How far would you go to protect your child?

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.sub-title: My Son Picked the Wrong Fiance
programme.desc: For the first time, a woman meets her soon-to-be daughter-in-law, whom she has called manipulative, immoral and disrespectful.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Police say a substitute teacher's blood-alcohol level was three times the legal limit, and video of their encounter in the school parking lot looks like a lesson in bad behavior.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: You hear about scams all the time - e-mails and voicemails claiming you have won valuable prizes. Dr. Phil is outraged by what some scammers are doing to him, his family and his viewers. One website offers a Dr. Phil quiz to win $5,000 every hour, another says it has the official Dr. Phil personality test, but even more shocking are 800 numbers that take callers' money for the promise of over the phone therapy with Dr. Phil and Robin. But these 800 numbers connect innocent victims with con artists posing as Dr. Phil staff members. The fake staffers ask anywhere from $375 to $1,000 for consultation time that obviously never takes place.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: The drama continues as Dr. Phil goes on the hunt for con artists who cheat viewers out of thousands of dollars by posing as him and Robin.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: How can you change a racist's thinking? How can someone who has had a racist viewpoint his entire life learn to accept a biracial granddaughter? Catch up on Charlie's story.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Do you know someone who makes big mistakes over and over? Dr. Phil gives his guests the wake-up calls they desperately need to stop repeating their destructive behavior.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.sub-title: My Ex Puts Fame Before Our Daughter
programme.desc: A couple is battling for custody of their 10-year-old daughter.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.sub-title: Ex Falsely Accused Me of Poisoning
programme.desc: A heated custody battle discussion continues with accusations of abuse and sabotage.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Couples confront post-honeymoon marriage challenges.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: The truth behind a toxic relationship between a student and professor.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.sub-title: My Friend is Obsessed with Me
programme.desc: Traci says her former friend, Jinda, is obsessed and infatuated with her. Traci says Jinda began texting her about 50 times a day after they first met -- texts that soon became over-the-top proclamations such as, “I can’t get you out of my mind," and “I swear I will love you the right way.” Traci says she thought Jinda just needed a friend but then grew more uncomfortable as, she claims, Jinda was also inappropriately affectionate with her children, began texting her friends whom she had never met, and even tried to touch and kiss her. Traci claims Jinda crossed the line when she tried to sabotage her marriage, so she cut off communication with her. But is Jinda getting the message? Traci says Jinda still texts and drives by her house, and she worries what Jinda might do next. Jinda admits to being "needy and clingy" but does she see that she's overstepped her boundaries? Can Dr. Phil help her rein in her behavior? Then, Kari says her sister, Holly, stabbed her in the back when she took Kari’s ex-husband’s side during their divorce -- and, after not speaking for three years, she wants an apology. Holly says she’s not sorry and that Kari is the one who needs to apologize. Can Dr. Phil end the silence between these sisters?

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: A self-proclaimed adult bully is confronted.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: The conversation continues with a self-admitted adult bully.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Couples who say their marriage is on the rocks due to debt.

programme.title: Dr.Phil
programme.sub-title: I'm a Slave to My Spouse
programme.desc: Dr. Phil talks to controlling guests and the loved ones who feel trapped by them. Jeffrey hates that his wife of seven months, Mindy, goes out clubbing with her younger friends, who he says are a bad influence on her. Mindy leaves the kids with Jeffrey's 16-year-old daughter and parties until 6:00 a.m., while he works the night shift. Mindy calls Jeffrey “a warden,” and says if he had his way, she’d never leave the house. Then, Jason claims his wife, Terrie, is lazy. He says he has to clean the house, do chores, take care of the kids and balance two checkbooks! Terrie says her large chest and arthritis prevent her from doing household tasks. Can Jason get his wife to clean up her act?
